title: Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The College of Health Care Professions
Interview Descriptions: Interview with Campus President, and or Corporate Director of Admissions, then either VP or CEO. 2-3 rounds, but they would hire quickly for the right candidate. Also depends on if it's a confidential search.
Interview Questions: What are your metrics and conversion rates?

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The College of Health Care Professions (Houston, TX) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: First interview with CFO and COO went well. But then they had an IT Financial analyst asking me about tech skills that were nowhere in their job description - majorly emphasizing SQL, while also telling me before the interview to not disclose the pay range for the role with the IT Financial Analyst. Total waste of time and a very insulting 2nd interview.
Interview Questions: How are your SQL skills ?

title: Director of Education Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The College of Health Care Professions (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The process is very well managed and personable.  The panel is interested in your approach to education, curriculum design, professional development, and student success. You can tell by the vibe in the room that everyone on the campus gets along and has fun while working hard.
Interview Questions: How have you been responsible for building a culture of student success in your previous roles?

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The College of Health Care Professions (Houston, TX) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers were courteous and genuine with their questions. They ensured that I was at ease and encouraged me to be myself. They treated me to lunch and were more than happy to sit, eat, and treat me as one of their own. They asked questions that looked to see if I fit the company culture, but were more than happy to disclose the company's history and standards.
Interview Questions: How do you manage time when given a project?

title: Social Media Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The College of Health Care Professions
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter was very nice and responsive. She answered all of my questions and was given ample time to make the decision about acceptinh the offer. I also felt well prepared for the in-person interview.
Interview Questions: What do you value most in a company?

title: Diagnostic Medical Sonographer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The College of Health Care Professions
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went very well.  I loved how fast it took once I got the phone call for an interview appointment. The staff were very sweet and kind. Loved everything about it.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a Sonographer? Why do you want to go to school with us?

title: Human Resources Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at The College of Health Care Professions (Houston, TX) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview itself went extremely well as far as the dialogue and calmness with myself and the interviewers.  One of the interviewees appeared to be bored and uninterested in the conversation.  I was told that they would be calling me back to meet with the CEO and to expect a call on a Thursday of the following week. The next week cane around, no call. I sent a follow up email and was informed I did not get the position. This was really frustrating because I was set for an expectation that they had no intentions on following through with. Moving forward, just be honest with the candidate. Rejection is ok. False hope is not!
Interview Questions: What opportunities are you looking for in your next role?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The College of Health Care Professions (Fort Worth, TX) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed shortly after applying. Interview was quick about 15 min. You have to fill out another application when you get there. Was given dates on when I would find out the outcome of the interview
Interview Questions: What would you do if you were having a hard time hitting your goals?

title: Admissions Advisor/Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The College of Health Care Professions (Fort Worth, TX) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with two ladies that made the process easy, I did an interview for 2 positions and as I stated they made the process enjoyable. Thank you, ladies, for the opportunity  to meet and greet with you
Interview Questions: They asked how would you be a great asset as well as my skills and ways that my skills will be a great fit for CHCP

title: Admissions Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at The College of Health Care Professions
Interview Descriptions: Very extensive process, I believe I went through about 5 interviews with different people, and all were a combination of phone or in person interviews. They will ask open ended questions about past experiences, and they try to see if you are a fit for the position.
Interview Questions: Describe a time in your past employer in which you had to deal with a difficult customer, and what you did to resolve the issue.

title: Financial Aid Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The College of Health Care Professions (San Antonio, TX) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I came at a time when the company was going through an audit, so I didnt really have the time to get to know the Director but I was asked to return and speak with the Director and was able to ask any questions and meet the staff
Interview Questions: Explain a time where I went over and beyond for someone?

title: Admissions Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at The College of Health Care Professions (Fort Worth, TX) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I completed a 5 round interview process.  First group, then 1:1 with DOA and President, 2 phone interviews and a final in person.  Pretty much meant I’d get an offer.  They then emailed me late in the afternoon, Friday asking for references of which they were never called.  I then waited until Tuesday and called to leave a message with the DOA to follow up; that call wasn’t returned. Next day then emailed her, and still haven’t heard back.  Felt that they wasn’t my time and money with all of the interviews and it was unprofessional to not at least let me know especially after all of that.  Good luck to those, read that there is also very high turnover.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stress?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at The College of Health Care Professions (Houston, TX) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly. Open about expectations. Asked different situational questions. Spoke with all levels of management and peers. Had to do instructional demonstration or video.  Had several phone interviews before coming in person.
Interview Questions: Doing a teaching demo

title: Admissions Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at The College of Health Care Professions (Houston, TX) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I don't know when I applied. I know it was weeks ago but when they called back the process went really fast. I missed the call but checked my email to see an assessment. I called her back and did a phone interview and completed the assessment the next day. I received a call the next day and was scheduled a face to face.  I had the job in 4 days.
Interview Questions: Am I ok with two late nights?

title: Admissions Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The College of Health Care Professions (San Antonio, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Went to interview and there were 20 other people there to interview.  I'm not fond of group interviews.  If you can't take the time to talk to me one on one, then I don't really want to work for you. Sounded like they were going to suck the life out of you and it was all about numbers.  Gave an opportunity for anyone to walk out, so I walked out.  Not sure what happened after that.
Interview Questions: None, the time I was there.  They did a power point presentation about the college and what they did.  Already knew all that because I took the time to research them before I went.

title: Medical Assistant Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The College of Health Care Professions (Dallas, TX) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: No different like any other interview. Meeting with campus presidents and DOE and other departmental managers. Filling out different applications and forms to complete the hiring process. Background  check and other processes that had to be performed and awaiting on the results.
Interview Questions: How do I feel about working with students?

title: Student Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The College of Health Care Professions
Interview Descriptions: Swift, very quick to arrange next level meetings. HR department member was very pleasant and provided prep information thoroughly to ensure ease through the process. Actually, the call from the recruiter is th first interview, which will supply a lot of information regarding the next person you'll have to meet with.
Interview Questions: They seemed very interested in knowing your career path expectations within 1 year.

title: IT Helpdesk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The College of Health Care Professions (Camarillo, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had three phone interviews. They were thorough with my skills assessment and they also asked me personal questions related to how I interact with end users. They also asked me questions on my background.  Through this process I interviewed with my department and corporate hr.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my work experience in the IT field what is my speciality and what are my opportunities.

title: Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The College of Health Care Professions
Interview Descriptions: Interview with Campus President, and or Corporate Director of Admissions, then either VP or CEO. 2-3 rounds, but they would hire quickly for the right candidate. Also depends on if it's a confidential search.
Interview Questions: What are your metrics and conversion rates?
